verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Solomon had finished the building of the house of the LORD, and the king’s house, and all Solomon’s desire which he was pleased to do,
verses.web: When Solomon had finished the building of LORD’s house, the king’s house, and all Solomon’s desire which he was pleased to do,
verses.ct: After Solomon had finished building the LORD's temple, the royal palace, and every other project he had set his heart on,

verses.kjv: That the LORD appeared to Solomon the second time, as he had appeared unto him at Gibeon.
verses.web: LORD appeared to Solomon the second time, as he had appeared to him at Gibeon.
verses.ct: the LORD appeared to him a second time, just as he had appeared to him at Gibeon.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, I have heard thy prayer and thy supplication, that thou hast made before me: I have hallowed this house, which thou hast built, to put my name there for ever; and mine eyes and mine heart shall be there perpetually.
verses.web: LORD said to him, “I have heard your prayer and your supplication, that you have made before me. I have made this house holy, which you have built, to put my name there forever; and my eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.
verses.ct: The LORD told him, "I have heard your prayer and your plea. I have set apart this temple you built, placing my name there forever. My eyes and my heart will be there always."

verses.kjv: And if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, in integrity of heart, and in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded thee, and wilt keep my statutes and my judgments:
verses.web: As for you, if you will walk before me, as David your father walked, in integrity of heart, and in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded you, and will keep my statutes and my ordinances;
verses.ct: "As for you — if you live your life before me the way your father David did, with an honest heart and integrity, obeying everything I've commanded and keeping my statutes and laws,"

verses.kjv: Then I will establish the throne of thy kingdom upon Israel for ever, as I promised to David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man upon the throne of Israel.
verses.web: then I will establish the throne of your kingdom over Israel forever, as I promised to David your father, saying, ‘There shall not fail from you a man on the throne of Israel.’
verses.ct: "then I will establish your royal throne over Israel forever, just as I promised your father David when I said, 'You will never lack a descendant on the throne of Israel.'"

verses.kjv: But if ye shall at all turn from following me, ye or your children, and will not keep my commandments and my statutes which I have set before you, but go and serve other gods, and worship them:
verses.web: But if you turn away from following me, you or your children, and not keep my commandments and my statutes which I have set before you, but go and serve other gods, and worship them;
verses.ct: "But if you or your descendants turn away from following me and refuse to keep my commandments and statutes that I've given you, and instead go off to serve and worship other gods,"

verses.kjv: Then will I cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them; and this house, which I have hallowed for my name, will I cast out of my sight; and Israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all people:
verses.web: then I will cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them; and I will cast this house, which I have made holy for my name, out of my sight; and Israel will be a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
verses.ct: "then I will cut Israel off from the land I gave them. I will reject this temple I set apart for my name, and Israel will become an object of ridicule and mockery among every nation."

verses.kjv: And at this house, which is high, every one that passeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss; and they shall say, Why hath the LORD done thus unto this land, and to this house?
verses.web: Though this house is so high, yet everyone who passes by it will be astonished and hiss; and they will say, ‘Why has LORD done this to this land, and to this house?’
verses.ct: "And though this temple now stands so impressive, everyone who passes by it will gasp in shock and scoff, asking, 'Why has the LORD done this to this land and this temple?'"

verses.kjv: And they shall answer, Because they forsook the LORD their God, who brought forth their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and have taken hold upon other gods, and have worshipped them, and served them: therefore hath the LORD brought upon them all this evil.
verses.web: and they will answer, ‘Because they abandoned LORD their God, who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and embraced other gods, and worshiped them, and served them. Therefore LORD has brought all this evil on them.’ ”
verses.ct: "And the answer will be: 'Because they abandoned the LORD their God, who brought their ancestors out of Egypt. They clung to other gods, worshiped them, and served them. That is why the LORD brought all this disaster on them.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, when Solomon had built the two houses, the house of the LORD, and the king’s house,
verses.web: At the end of twenty years, in which Solomon had built the two houses, LORD’s house and the king’s house
verses.ct: It took Solomon 20 years to complete the two major building projects — the LORD's temple and the royal palace.

verses.kjv: (Now Hiram the king of Tyre had furnished Solomon with cedar trees and fir trees, and with gold, according to all his desire,) that then king Solomon gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.
verses.web: (now Hiram the king of Tyre had furnished Solomon with cedar trees and cypress trees, and with gold, according to all his desire), King Solomon gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.
verses.ct: King Hiram of Tyre had supplied Solomon with all the cedar, cypress timber, and gold he wanted, so Solomon gave Hiram 20 cities in the region of Galilee as payment.

verses.kjv: And Hiram came out from Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him; and they pleased him not.
verses.web: Hiram came out of Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him; and they didn’t please him.
verses.ct: But when Hiram traveled from Tyre to inspect the cities Solomon had given him, he was not impressed.

verses.kjv: And he said, What cities are these which thou hast given me, my brother? And he called them the land of Cabul unto this day.
verses.web: He said, “What cities are these which you have given me, my brother?” He called them the land of Cabul to this day.
verses.ct: He said, "What kind of cities are these you've given me, my brother?" So he nicknamed the area the land of Cabul, and it's still called that today.

verses.kjv: And Hiram sent to the king sixscore talents of gold.
verses.web: Hiram sent to the king one hundred twenty talents of gold.
verses.ct: Hiram had sent the king 120 talents of gold.

verses.kjv: And this is the reason of the levy which king Solomon raised; for to build the house of the LORD, and his own house, and Millo, and the wall of Jerusalem, and Hazor, and Megiddo, and Gezer.
verses.web: This is the reason of the levy which king Solomon raised, to build LORD’s house, his own house, Millo, Jerusalem’s wall, Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.
verses.ct: Here is the account of the forced labor that King Solomon used to build the LORD's temple, his own palace, the Millo, the wall of Jerusalem, and the cities of Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.

verses.kjv: For Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up, and taken Gezer, and burnt it with fire, and slain the Canaanites that dwelt in the city, and given it for a present unto his daughter, Solomon’s wife.
verses.web: Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up, taken Gezer, burned it with fire, killed the Canaanites who lived in the city, and given it for a wedding gift to his daughter, Solomon’s wife.
verses.ct: Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, had attacked and captured Gezer, burned it to the ground, and killed the Canaanites living there. He then gave the city as a wedding gift to his daughter, Solomon's wife.

verses.kjv: And Solomon built Gezer, and Bethhoron the nether,
verses.web: Solomon built in the land Gezer, Beth Horon the lower,
verses.ct: Solomon rebuilt Gezer, along with Lower Beth Horon,

verses.kjv: And Baalath, and Tadmor in the wilderness, in the land,
verses.web: Baalath, Tamar in the wilderness,
verses.ct: Baalath, and Tadmor in the wilderness — all within his territory.

verses.kjv: And all the cities of store that Solomon had, and cities for his chariots, and cities for his horsemen, and that which Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
verses.web: all the storage cities that Solomon had, the cities for his chariots, the cities for his horsemen, and that which Solomon desired to build for his pleasure in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
verses.ct: He also built all his storage cities, cities for his chariots, cities for his horsemen, and whatever else he wanted to build in Jerusalem, in Lebanon, and throughout his entire kingdom.

verses.kjv: And all the people that were left of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, which were not of the children of Israel,
verses.web: As for all the people who were left of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who were not of the children of Israel;
verses.ct: There were still people left in the land from the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites — people who were not Israelites.

verses.kjv: Their children that were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel also were not able utterly to destroy, upon those did Solomon levy a tribute of bondservice unto this day.
verses.web: their children who were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel were not able utterly to destroy, of them Solomon raised a levy of bondservants to this day.
verses.ct: Their descendants, whom the Israelites had not been able to completely destroy, Solomon conscripted into forced labor — and they remain in forced labor to this day.

verses.kjv: But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no bondmen: but they were men of war, and his servants, and his princes, and his captains, and rulers of his chariots, and his horsemen.
verses.web: But of the children of Israel Solomon made no bondservants; but they were the men of war, his servants, his princes, his captains, and rulers of his chariots and of his horsemen.
verses.ct: Solomon did not make any Israelites into forced laborers. Instead, they served as his soldiers, officials, commanders, captains, and chariot and cavalry officers.

verses.kjv: These were the chief of the officers that were over Solomon’s work, five hundred and fifty, which bare rule over the people that wrought in the work.
verses.web: These were the five hundred fifty chief officers who were over Solomon’s work, who ruled over the people who labored in the work.
verses.ct: There were 550 chief officers who supervised Solomon's projects and managed the workers carrying out the labor.

verses.kjv: But Pharaoh’s daughter came up out of the city of David unto her house which Solomon had built for her: then did he build Millo.
verses.web: But Pharaoh’s daughter came up out of David’s city to her house which Solomon had built for her. Then he built Millo.
verses.ct: Once Pharaoh's daughter moved from the city of David into the palace Solomon had built for her, he then constructed the Millo.

verses.kjv: And three times in a year did Solomon offer burnt offerings and peace offerings upon the altar which he built unto the LORD, and he burnt incense upon the altar that was before the LORD. So he finished the house.
verses.web: Solomon offered burnt offerings and peace offerings on the altar which he built to LORD three times per year, burning incense with them, on the altar that was before LORD. So he finished the house.
verses.ct: 3 times a year, Solomon offered burnt offerings and peace offerings on the altar he had built for the LORD, and he burned incense before the LORD. In this way, he fulfilled the purpose of the temple.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon made a navy of ships in Eziongeber, which is beside Eloth, on the shore of the Red sea, in the land of Edom.
verses.web: King Solomon made a fleet of ships in Ezion Geber, which is beside Eloth, on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.
verses.ct: King Solomon also built a fleet of ships at Ezion Geber, which is near Eloth on the shore of the Red Sea in the land of Edom.

verses.kjv: And Hiram sent in the navy his servants, shipmen that had knowledge of the sea, with the servants of Solomon.
verses.web: Hiram sent in the fleet his servants, sailors who had knowledge of the sea, with the servants of Solomon.
verses.ct: Hiram sent experienced sailors from his own fleet to serve alongside Solomon's men.

verses.kjv: And they came to Ophir, and fetched from thence gold, four hundred and twenty talents, and brought it to king Solomon.
verses.web: They came to Ophir, and fetched from there gold, four hundred and twenty talents, and brought it to king Solomon.
verses.ct: They sailed to Ophir, where they acquired 420 talents of gold and brought it back to King Solomon.
